creator: glenn@apache.org
text:
Ant is now used by Tomcat's Jasper 2 for compiling JSP pages.
Tomcat runs with the Java SecurityManager and invokes ant
classes to compile JSP pages.

If you want to use ant with an external compiler like jikes
you have to grant the following FilePermission:

permission java.io.FilePermission "<<ALL FILES>>, "read,execute";

This is too broad a permission grant for those who use a strict
java security policy and prevents use of an external compiler
like jikes.

The following enhancement would fix the problem:

Add another property called build.compiler.path in addition to
the build.compiler property.  This property would be set to
the complete path of the jikes (or other external compiler) path.

For example: -Dbuild.compiler=jikes -Dbuild.compiler.path=/usr/local/bin/jikes

Then in org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.compiler.Jikes.java
the following code which sets the executable would use the
property if it existed.

        Commandline cmd = new Commandline();
        cmd.setExecutable("jikes");

A path attribute could be added to the compiler element of javac to set
the complete full path to the jikes or other external compiler.

creator: stevel@apache.org
text:
In ant1.6, you can set the path to the compiler using the executable attribute
of the <javac> task; use this to specify the location of jikes. 

Marking as fixed; please reopen if it doesnt work with the security manager
scenario you have described.
